info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 12:11PM EDT until April 17 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River from Seymour to Shoals.
.Major flooding continues on the East Fork White River. The crest on the East Fork was just past Williams Thursday afternoon and forecast to reach Shoals early Friday morning. Seymour should fall below flood stage early Friday morning, while points downstream will stay above flood stage until around next Thursday April 17. Chances for showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening could bring total rainfall amounts of a tenth of an inch to a quarter inch with potential for localized amounts to half an inch. This is not expected to raise the crest, but could lengthen the time in flood if the higher amounts fall in the basin.
* WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Fork White River at Shoals.
* WHEN...Until Thursday, April 17.
* IMPACTS...At 30.1 feet, During the March 2008 flood, SR 550 extensively flooded on the left bank of the river bridge. One county road on the left bank is totally submerged and another near the hill is barely visible. The south bound lane on the right bank of the river is barely passable, but once over the bridge it ends in deep, fast flowing flood water. There is no Hindostan Falls, just a very big river. Water near SR 550 just before turn off to the Falls. One farmer must boat into his house.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 31.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Thursday was 31.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, April 17. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 315 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, APRIL 17

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Dubois, IN; Martin, IN; Pike, IN
